intro: Craspedodictyum schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's spurge, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in xerophytic plant adaptations.
